creator: Benedict Smith
title: Politics latest news: Suella Braverman says Tories face electoral oblivion if they fail on Rwanda plan
dc:creator: Benedict Smith
content:
Suella Braverman said the Tories face “electoral oblivion” if they fail to implement their Rwanda plan.

The former home secretary, making a resignation statement in the Commons, said Rishi Sunak will lead his party to a disastrous defeat if he introduces emergency legislation on Rwanda which is “destined to fail”.

She revealed she had told the Prime Minister he should scrap the bill and replace it with more robust legislation excluding asylum claims from international and human rights laws. 

Ms Braverman told MPs: “It is now or never. The Conservative Party faces electoral oblivion in a matter of months if we introduce yet another Bill destined to fail. 

“Do we fight for sovereignty or let our party die? I refuse to sit by and allow the trust that millions of people have put in us be discarded like an inconvenient detail.”

]]>
contentSnippet:

Ms Braverman told MPs: “It is now or never. The Conservative Party faces electoral oblivion in a matter of months if we introduce yet another Bill destined to fail. 
“Do we fight for sovereignty or let our party die? I refuse to sit by and allow the trust that millions of people have put in us be discarded like an inconvenient detail.”
